comment.author: 51642071@N00
comment._content: This looks so beautiful and intricate! I wish I was there to see it...

comment.author: 27398485@N08
comment._content: Edmund Dulac had many talents, he designed furniture, theater sets, collaborated with W.B Yeats on theater projects, designed costumes, composed and played music to a few Yeats poems, even played the bamboo nose flute, and was a crack shot marksman.  Charles De Gaulle personally commissioned him (Dulac was living in London by then) to produce the first post WWII French postage stamp. He was fascinated by British lifestyle, (became a British citizen) and artistic inspiration of the Orient.
